channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffitti on the lister practice sign, 16th August
item.description:
Lots of graffiti on the lister practice sign

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101, Peckham Road, Peckham, London

item.title: Sewage on pavement and driveway, 16th August
item.description:
Due to the recent heavy rains our street gutters overflowed with sewage. This has dried out over the last few days and is now hardened on the pavement and road. It needs a good high pressure wash.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maple Close, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 16th August
item.description:
In thomes line se6 4RQ next to traffic lights is a bed mattress it was put there Friday as I was comeing home from work it come from the firsts above the shops next the agent who sell and rent

item.title: Whole tree cut up and dumped on pavement, 16th August

Whole tree and a metal post dumped at corner of Alcestet Crescent and Mount Pleasant Lane- stretches half was across pavement - large trunk sticking g put

item.title: Raised kerb along footpath, 16th August
item.description:
Opposite the Batt Cables entrance there are 2 raised kerbs that pose a danger to anyone walking down that footpath especially at night.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fraser Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The bin at the 180 bus stop needs emptying, 16th August
item.description:
Since removing 2 public bins from the shops at the Pom Pom the council seem to now not bother to empty those that remain. The one at the 180 bus stop is one. The bus drivers now also put the bus rubbish in black sacks and leave them there too so Bexley need to charge TFL for street cleaning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fraser Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Been there for a few days, 16th August
item.description:
The alarm is always going off, neighbors have put notes on window screens about this. It's not parked in the bay properly and the back tyre is on grass verge

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Welling Way, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another nasty thorn bush, 16th August
item.description:
At the bottom of the stairs and the corner of the Batt Cables site is the 4th of a set of these thorn bushes that pose a danger to passing pedestrians. This one is hanging from a tree and is hanging about 4.5 feet from the floor.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alford Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 16th August
item.description:
This has been added too in recent days and will continue too, need cameras or signs to discourage

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grange Crescent, London

item.title: Another nasty bush, 16th August
item.description:
Another nasty bush on Fraser Road opposite Hawthorn Place. It’s overhanging the footpath and as this is the walk to the 180 first bus stop this will pose a real danger to anyone who uses this footpath. This is one of 4 along this small stretch of pavement that are a danger to the public
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alford Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping near Rossignton Street/Vyner Court, 16th August
item.description:
Lots of rubbish, cones and bags in the street, looks like it’s been there for a while can someone remove it please

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cypress Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Second report on Fraser Road of these nasty thorn bushes, 16th August
item.description:
Just along from the first bush on the corner is a second bush that is totally overhanging the footpath. Again, this has nasty large thorns that will rip a small child’s face to shreds and is a danger. These keep getting cut back but they are so dangerous that they need removing. Trimming is not good enough

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alford Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose and cracked pavement bricks, 16th August
item.description:
Pavement bricks are loose when hedge was removed bricks came loose as no concrete to hold them in place

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Malmains Way, Park Langley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sofas dumped, 16th August
item.description:
Sofas dumped in garage area causing access issues. Also thrown into verge at end of garages causing bushes to protrude.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ranworth Close, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous, fast growing nasty bush, 16th August
item.description:
I report this nasty bush at least once a year. Now that the primary school is open this bush (and others further up Fraser Road) pose a real danger to young children and babies in prams due to their incredibly nasty thorns. These bushes need removal not just cutting back. They will do a small child’s face some real damage and need urgent attention

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): De Luci Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog poo, 16th August
item.description:
Someone hasn't cleaned up after their dog
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Seward Road, Elmers End, London
